title: Exemption from strict liability
context: [PART III. GENERAL PROVISIONS] Revision Note This part was renumbered from part IV. [ยง327-51] Exemption from strict liability. No physician, surgeon, hospital, blood bank, tissue bank, or other person or entity who donates, obtains, prepares, transplants, injects, transfuses, or otherwise transfers, or who assists or participates in obtaining, preparing, transplanting, injecting, transfusing, or otherwise transferring any tissue, organ, blood or component thereof, from one or more persons, living or dead, to another person, shall be liable as a result of any such activity, save and except that each such person or entity shall remain liable for the person&rsquo;s or its own negligence or wilful misconduct. [L 1971, c 102, ยง1; gen ch 1985] Law Journals and Reviews Tort and Insurance &ldquo;Reform&rdquo; in a Common Law Court. 14 UH L. Rev. 55. Case Notes Blood shield law precluded strict liability but not negligence claims of hemophiliac exposed to AIDS virus through injections of blood component, although actual tortfeasor was not identified, under market-share theory of liability. 72 H. 416, 823 P.2d 717; 971 F.2d 375.
